channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The next Israeli hostages Hamas will release include U.S. and Russian nationals
item.description: Hamas says it will release three hostages on Saturday, resolving a dispute with Israel that threatened to derail the ceasefire. In exchange, Israel wi...

item.title: Ancient Egyptian mummies still smell nice, study finds
item.description: Rsearchers find nine mummies they examined all smelled "woody", "spicy" and "sweet".

item.title: Change in California law could provide path to freedom for a convicted killer

item.title: Eating yogurt regularly may reduce the risk of colon cancer, a study finds
item.description: Humans have been eating yogurt for millennia. Ancient texts reference its health-promoting properties. Now a new study finds yogurt may reduce the ris...

item.title: Resignations after DOJ tells prosecutors to drop NY mayor case
item.description: Top New York attorney Danielle Sassoon is among several prosecutors to quit over an order to drop a corruption case against Eric Adams.

item.title: The revolution will be screenshot (hopefully)
item.description: Code Switch's B.A. Parker takes a look at the many ways our digital world is being erased.

item.title: Chernobyl radiation shield hit by Russian drone, Ukraine says
item.description: There has been no increase in radiation levels at the plant, Ukraine's president says.

item.title: Hamas releases names of hostages due for release on Saturday
item.description: They are set to be released in exchange for Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.

item.title: An Israeli raid of a famous Palestinian bookstore stokes censorship fears
item.description: A famous Palestinian-owned bookstore in East Jerusalem was raided by Israeli police, stoking fears of increased censorship.

item.title: Including people without legal status in census has had little impact on House seats, study finds
This week on "Sunday Morning" (February 16)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: Can suspending a cage-free egg law solve the soaring price problem? Nevada takes a crack at it
Infant mortality rises in US states with abortion bans, study finds
item.description: Some states restrict access for women following the overturning of Roe v Wade.
